word: When I open a letter beginning, "I am sorry to trouble you, Sister White, but I am in trouble, and I wish to know something in regard to my family and in regard to myself," I feel so sad at heart. When it is essential for you to know, God will let you know. He has promised that if you ask wisdom from Him, He will give it to you. But it is not always essential for us to know all the whys and wherefores. We dishonor God by striving to get someone who we think understands our case to help us. Has He not given us His only begotten Son? Is not Christ close beside us, and will He not give us the help we need? "Lo, I am with you alway," He says, "even unto the end of the world." His Word repeats the promise over and over again. "If ye shall ask any thing in My name, I will do it" [John 14:14], He says. "If ye love Me, keep My commandments."
